description:
We needed a dinner spot in a clench and Urban Tavern came through. The service was great the Hostess was very nice and got us a table that was perfect because we had to eat fast to make our show. Our server was Josway super nice guy and great server. 

The food was delicious and there was vegan and gluten free entree options perfect for our party. We had the chicken fried mushrooms and the seasoning and risotto with it was very tasty. My GF sister had the steak and I had the pasta. Joseay put the cherry on our night by sending out a butter cake with poach pears (it was my sisters birthday) absolutely delicious. Perfect dinner.
author: Sage D.

description:
Although it's said that it's not good for kids in yelp, they actually are kids friendly. We came in with a troller and were offered a table close to stroller parking and convenient for getting a high chair.

Food portion is reasonable and not super big like many other American restaurants. Three of us shared three appetizers, two main course and two desserts. 

Recommend dishes like the burrata salad, five layer pork, and mango and sticky rice.
author: Weijia L.

description:
Pumping modern pub grub attached to the Hilton Union Square. Food was great, service inconsistent.  

Solo diner as usual, but I was the given the option of a communal bench, two-spot table top or bar seating. Nice to have choice. My assigned waiter was courteous but distracted. 

Kicked off with the charred shishito peppers, which were delicious: grilled just right and drizzled with a nicely umami mayo and fresh coriander (cilantro!) greens. Light and perfect for sharing. 

My main was the Urban burger without bun. Mixed outcome here. I'll give the accompanying fries a big thumbs up for their crispy savoury taste. The burger itself was poorly composed, and without the bun it was a big hot mess. Bunless is generally a hot mess anyway, but this one more so than usual. IMHO the fillings were cut too thick to be manageable. The meat was over cooked and quite dry, plus it needed quite a bit of seasoning to bring it to life. First world problems...

The Rusty Negroni was ok, nothing spectacular. A little watery. I asked for a wine recommendation that wasn't too bad. 

The hostess gets a big thumbs up from me. She kept checking in on me, had a couple of chats and kept me entertained. 

I'd return to try some if the other dishes, but I'd skip the burger next time.
author: Richard L.

description:
I came twice during the week I was in SF for a convention, because it was convenient (at the hotel I was staying at) and because I saw a sign for s'more sundaes. Okay, let's get real, it was really for the s'more sundae. 

The place itself had warm lighting, modern decor, and kind wait staff. They will seat you even if your party have not all arrived. The bar area looked pretty cute but didn't get a chance to check it out. 

The first time I came, I made the mistake of ordering actual food before desert. I had the 8-hr bolognese, which was hearty, filling, and delicious. The problem was the filling part. So, no room for ice cream. Not to be deterred, I came again a couple nights later and was a little more clever. I ordered an appetizer and the sundae. The meatballs were tender and moist and I loved the sauce they were smothered in. The veg seemed a tiny bit wilted but the bleu cheese whip was light and fluffy. As expected, the s'mores sundae was as amazing as I had hoped. Sweet vanilla-y/marshmallow-y ice cream, a side of torched marshmallows, chocolate sauce with some crunchy choc bits, and a graham cracker bar. Omg, it was the best thing ever. Perfect serving size. Don't share it. Just don't.
author: Sally C.

description:
Today was a long day of delayed flights.  I am tired and potentially short on patience.  It takes more to impress me today than on other days.  I am impressed.  The Urban Tavern was 495 feet from my body position on earth and I was hungry.  The hostess was a bit um, uncertain and it took a good minute of thinking to get a table.  This left me concerned. 

The non alcoholic pomegranate ginger punch was a good start.  This drink was not sugary and was fresh, flavorful and a bit spicy from the ginger beer.  The photos show the kimchi fries and charred octopus appetizers. Both blew me away.  The menu description did not do their complex flavor justice.  The server, KJ, was fantastic.  Ask for her.  Really.  She anticipated needs before I knew I had needs.  On the food shows the chefs say if a restaurant has pimento cheese you should try it.  I could not eat another appetizer so I ordered the burger with pimento cheese, onion jam and avocado. I could not decide what I wanted and the true test of a good restaurant is can they make a burger special.  A burger is not my typical pick but this burger.  Sigh.  This burger was fantastic. 

KJ recommended that since we were full that we take a dessert menu back to the hotel.  This way we could stop for dessert tomorrow.  She really is a professional server giving fantastic service in an industry where this does not always happen.  She loved food.  So foodies getting a foodie server is appreciated.  

I will not only say go here.  But I will say that this is a meal I will remember and miss and that is rare.   I am going to put on pajamas and reminisce before my full stomach falls asleep.
author: Kori H.

description:
The chicken meatballs were served with a whipped blue cheese and sat in a spicy hot sauce--they were the favorite at the table.  We ordered three dishes of them to start things off--whoops!   The idea of whipping blue cheese drew us all in and we just had to see what that actually meant.
The pic explains it all.  Clap! Clap! Clap!

Urban Tavern plates their dishes beautifully and has created a menu filled with diverse, unique choices that will please anyone's palate.

The menu is divided into small plates/large plates and you can mix and match as you like.

I asked for two small plates and they were to be the extent of my dinner: the charred, Spanish octopus and the Kimchi fries.

Kimchi fries???   I had to find out what they were all about but first came the octopus.  I loved it--it was meaty yet tender and sat in a nice romesco sauce with accompanying chorizo and tomato chutney.  It was light tasting and also what I thought would be a rather healthy choice to pair with the Kimchi fries considering that they were about as unhealthy as you could get...

People--you must order the Kimchi fries--they are steak fries covered in short rib, carmelized kimchi, and smoked fiscalini cheddar!
What a combo.  No one at the table likes kimchi except me so I got to eat the entire thing by myself.  ( I am walking an extra 10,000 steps today as penance.)

The burger with added cage-free egg was a big hit for another diner too.  
Service was great.  There are creative cocktails to choose from as well as a pretty standard beer menu.

We went up to Cityscape after dinner for a nightcap--great views up there!
author: Thomas D.

description: I'm not sure what's worse listening to the bartenders talk bad about other employees or the horrible food menu. Staying in the area haven't been to San Fran in awhile hope this joke of a place isn't the start to the weekend.
author: Erica K.

description:
Wanting to dine within walking distance of our hotel, discovered this gem.  Moderately noisy, nicely decorated décor and a comfortable place to dine after a day in the city. We chose several smalls to share, enjoyed them all.  

Milk Bread-simple, sweet & salty
Smash Fries-well executed, very tasty
Pork Belly & Waffle-I really didn't want to share this one, it was that good.  Delightfully tender pork belly paired with a lovely plum jam. What a treat this dish was!
Chicken Meatballs-a nice riff on buffalo chicken flavors
author: Kristi C.

description:
Had dinner before a show in A.C.T theatre on a week day night. 

Food are exceptional. The plating is beautiful. Love both formal dining area as well as the casual bar area. We ended up sitting at the casual bar area for dinner so as to enjoy a bit more of people watching.
author: Shell J.

description: Ok food since we were having a seminar. Nice ambiance though. Food selection minimal.
author: Cay A.

description:
Went here with high expectations & left disappointed. Sure, then vibe and space is cool and the service was fine. But the food.....

Roasted Endive & Beluga Lentils - first of all, if I hadn't spit out the endives I'd still be chewing them. Very difficult to eat. Overall the dish could have potential but honestly the flavor was very boring. It's new to the menu so maybe they can adjust. 

Burger- came over cooked. 

Fries- cold and soggy. 

Mushroom ragout - this dish was actually not too shabby. Almost tasted like bruschetta w/ mushrooms. I'd order it again. 

I suppose for a restaurant that is connected to a hotel, expectations shouldn't be high anyway (rare to find good "hotel" food!).
author: Rob M.

description: We went here for dinner before going to see a show at the Orpheum Theatre. The service was excellent. We we're about 9 min late but was seated right away. The hostess was very friendly and the waitress was very accommodating. She did forget to tell us that they ran out of the octopus in the small dish section. We ordered the milk bread that was tasty but wished it was warm. The bread melted in my mouth and the honey butter was tasty. We had the pork and waffle dish and the Burrata salad to start. The pork and the sauce was great, the waffle was crispy on the outside and soft inside. The flavors putting it together wasn't as good. It felt like they were trying hard to mesh the flavors together. For our main we shared the pasta with Bolognese sauce and was great but should have been warmer. They even split it for us which was a plus. Overall was an ok experience.
author: raimundo t.

description:
Chinese dish cooked by a white Chef from Texas apprenticed in Asian Restaurant in NY.

This restaurant is such a hidden gem. Remodeled and newly opened with delicious Asian fusion cuisine and wonderful service by Michelle. She's very insightful and takes a very big pride in the restaurant. You can tell she treats the restaurant as it's her own and was going above and beyond for the customers. 

Impressed with food quality, service and ambiance. A couple next to us got engaged (proposed) and another celebrating their bday. Celebratory location but fairly well priced for the value. 

Highly recommended for happy hour, date or special occasion.
author: Kwiri Y.

description:
This restaurant is connected to my hotel so you can't beat the convenience. I sat at the bar, which had a little draft from the front door, but not too bad. The bartender was there when we needed him, but also gave us our space.
I ordered the arugula salad to start. I really liked the balance of the creamy, goat cheese-like labneh, the strawberries, and the vinaigrette dressing. I also got the Bibimbap with chicken. The presentation was pretty and the flavor was good, but it was not served in a stone bowl, therefore the rice didn't get crispy as it traditionally does, so it could have been better in my eyes. The wine list had a nice local assortment, so I tried some Pinot Gris from the Russian River area.
author: Christina M.

description:
Great service, great food.

Octopus - nice texture which meant it was cooked perfectly. The chorizo gives it a nice kick.

Kimchi Fries - kimchi is not too strong which I preferred. Fries are crispy just how I like it. Short rib is nice and tender.

Steak - cooked well but not as filling as I hoped.
author: Geoffrey C.

description: Cool vibe very chill lots of pillows and bay windows to steal peeks of the city. Happy hour was pretty descent ordered the pride dessert was not impressed at all overall the service was good and the location clean sheet atmosphere couldn't ask for more at the time
author: Bettina C.

description:
Yo, im 50 and love good food and ale
..had enough for the day but dtpped in for a night cap and this ragu was fresh and on point..will be back and the Brew is right on
author: todd c.

description:
This review is not only for Urban Tavern, but for our server KJ! Me and three of my friends went to dinner here a few Saturdays ago and we left very pleased. 

KJ was attentive, kind, and knowledgable about the menu. In addition, she ensured that we enjoyed our time that evening. We would definitely come back :)
author: Lauren K.

description: I can't understand anyone giving this place a good review.  Worst meal I've had in a long time.  Arugula salad tasted of nothing but salt!  And the chicken was dry, bland, and ... you guessed it - tasted like nothing but salt.  Menu is also too limited, and the place is incredibly noisy.  Only good thing was the California wine on the menu (although incredibly overpriced, but then this place is in a hotel).  Wish I'd gone across the street to Halal Guys but I only noticed it after I had ordered.  Don't eat here.
author: Cindy T.

description: I just randomly stumbled upon this place and had a very pleasant experience. It almost looks like a nice sports bar but the food doesn't reflect that scene at all. I was eating by myself so I did a couple of small plates (mostly lol). For drink I ordered the whisky cocktail they had which was really pricy ($16) but it was strong and good. Then I ordered the charred octopus and the mushroom side that were both absolutely fantastic. I was completely full by the time my third dish came which was the grilled endives (not a small plate). this was a vegetarian dish and was pretty good. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I wasn't so full. The green sauce on it was fabulous. Overall a great experience and would return.
author: Sam P.

description:
Summary: Great decor, good hotel food, and easy to get in.

We were heading to a show at The Warfield and wanted to grab dinner before. We decided at the last minute to try out Urban Tavern and walked in without a reservation and were seated right away. It's connected to the Hilton Hotel although there is also an entrance directly on O'Farrell.

We ordered the Charred Spanish Octopus and Pork Belly & Waffles from the "Smalls" portion of the menu and the the steak from the "Not so smalls."

Overall, everything was tasty. The waffle was a little cold and soft but the dish came together well. The dishes were sauced heavily but lacked the sophistication of the top restaurants in SF. It reminds me a lot like the "hotel" food at Taste on Ellis.
author: Yi Z.

description:
This restaurant is a part of the Hilton hotel. Very good. Had the chicken meatballs, which were tangy/spicy, and the burger, which was fantastic (except for the bun being dry.) 

Service was great, but it did take a while to get our entrees and it seemed like people around us who ordered after us got their food before we did. The waiter was aware and apologetic and checked on us just the right amount.
author: Cosmin K.

description:
Mmm not all that impressed with the Urban Tavern. The meal had its highs and lows so it kinda just averaged out to a okay ish kinda meal. 

Me and my buddy mostly just ordered off their small bites section of the menu and just shared a bunch of these. The milk bread was good upon first bite, but it has this huge chunk of salt on the crust that is just overwhelming if you eat it. The kimchi fries are disappointing in that you can barely call the cabbage kimchi and that the fries were huge. The best part of the meal was the octopus! This was yummy and went with the provided sauce very well. 

Anyways, it was just an okay meal to be honest. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to go back here.
author: Sean H.

description: Had more of a hotel vibe than I anticipated, but the food did not disappoint. The shishito peppers were perfectly seasoned with a nice creamy aioli and fresh greens which were really nice and balancing for the heat those things packed. Great beer on tap as well.
author: Ashley C.

description: KJ was amazing and made our evening so enjoyable. She was a wonderful culinary guide to great food and wine. Thank you KJ.
author: Alexander C.

description: Went there at about 730, they didn't have a table for us because they were reserved.  So we sat at the bar, the bartender was pretty nice and gave us a menu then asked if we wanted a drink.  We ordered a Moscow mule and I forgot the name of the other drink but it was pretty tasty then we ordered food, the milk bread was DELICIOUS and I love this thick cut fries~^_^. Definitely will go back to try out their other stuff~!!
author: Irene M.

description:
NAILED IT!!!!!!

Anyone traveling from anywhere around the world, or locally should stop by and eat, drink and be merry here at Urban Tavern. Great food and service. Loud, but fun atmosphere.  If you have a show to make it to, they will rush your order, to help you out.  We've been coming here for years.  Thanks Urban Tavern employees for being great.  See you next time. 

2 Taste Budz
author: Taste B.

description: The pork animal style waffle was really good as was the milk bread. Their unique cocktails are delicious. This is definitely NOT the typical hotel restaurant.
author: Meredith S.

description: Tasty burger (sans bun) with pimento cheese and a subbed side salad. Lively atmosphere with plenty of screens to view sports. Convenient bar seating for solo dining. Quick service and ability to charge to room since I was at the Hilton. Would return to try more menu offerings!
author: B L J.

description: Excellent bar service. Choose to eat at the bar and served by one of the most attentive bartenders ever. Delicious food. I stick to a small plate. I ordered the chicken meatballs and it was like eating hot wings with the best blue cheese. I also ordered a side a baby bok choy that says expertly cooked. The expresso martini was on point with two shots of fresh smooth expresso. Overall a great experience for a place I picked at the last minute.
author: Toni R.

description:
Dinner review. 

Caviar of the South (pimento cheese, bell pepper tapioca chips) - 5
Urban burger (bacon onion jam) - 3
Roasted jidori Peking chicken - 3

Overall, I'd come back for the dip. "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description:
Keeping it short, the service is below optimal, the food is tasteless and the ambience is very depressing. 

The burrata salad lacked seasoning but I have to add that the persimmon was definitely a great addition to the salad. The octopus was probably the best thing we ordered. Different but tasty. Finally, the eight hour pasta bolognese which was highly recommended by the server tasted as if it came straight from the can.
author: Asieh G.

description: This place has some of the best cocktails I've ever had. I think one of the best things was the waitress KJ who was amazing and super nice who was a 10 out of 5 waitresses
author: Jonah P.

description:
Wonderful atmosphere and great staff!!!
Food was incredible and we shared the salmon and beef strip, smashed fries were delish. The creamy garlic soup and bread were to die for and these two are a must.
author: GiGi V.

description:
This has to be the best meal I have ever had in SF. Amazing mix of cultures, tastes and spices. I am truly impressed with what the chef prepared. The pimento cheese was better than anything found in the South and the chicken was better than Beijing duck in China. 

Lastly our waitress was absolutely wonderful, charming and helpful in helping us decide on our meal and making this a great experience. 

This place is a MUST!!!!
author: Eric V.

description: Excellent kimchi fries! Packed with flavor and serves enough to be an entree. Service is amazing, very friendly and inviting!
author: Amber C.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday, this place is located in the Hilton Hotel. Restaurant is pretty nice and not too big or small with big TVs for the game.

We ordered:
Chicken Meatballs: I liked this, it had blue cheese and buffalo sauce, great combo. Kind of pricey for only three meat balls though 
Ahi Tuna: OK, fish wasn't very fresh. 
Roasted Cauliflower: Decent, good appetizer if you are looking for something no the lighter side
The Urban Tonic: This drink was delicious, carbonate fruity drink, I recommend.

Overall, I wouldn't come back again because I feel the portions are too small but prices are high, there are better places in the city to go eat.
author: Natalie L.

description:
Really cute restaurant inside of the Hilton hotel near Union Square. The decor was beautiful and the attentive service was good too. The only disappointment was the menu is fairly limited and the chef really didn't deliver.

I had the corn chowder with blue crab, which tasted great but was about half as big as it should've been. I also had the mushroom appetizer, which was wonderfully prepared and very large. I've never had so many mushrooms on the plate at a restaurant before.

My partner got the ramen, which was the most disappointing thing on the table. It was bland even with the unagi-bomb side dish that she was instructed to put in it. 

If you like good ramen then this really isn't the place to have it.  If you want a cute place near Union Square that isn't too $$$$ then give them a try.
author: Paul C.

description: Excellent waiter but very limited menu. Convenient to Union Sq and adjacent to Hilton. Bread is ala carte. Food was expensive but pretty tasty
author: Fred G.

description: Get the Korean BBQ tacos! Anthony and Jose are awesome bartenders. We had four orders of the tacos for happy hour. They also have great drink specials too.
author: T, P.

description: The food here was great from what we had. But hit give it up to Anthony the bartender. Made me and my girlfriend feel very welcome and gave us some great recommendations. Came in pretty much every night to have some drinks and chop it up with him. Give this guy a raise!!! Great service and great drinks. Made her some off the menu drinks to suit her preference!
author: Darrin P.

description: Everything about my experience there was great, food, drinks service etc. my guests were from Italy and also really enjoyed everything. Nice job !!!
author: Edwaldo P.

description:
I was staying in the hotel and didn't want to go far, so I tried this place. It was amazing!

For an appetizer, I got the Pork Belly Waffle which was a delicious blend of flavors and textures. It was a beautiful presentation, but I really had to stop myself from licking the plate - the dish was that good.

My main course was the gnocchi. It was probably the most interesting gnocchi I've ever had. So soft and pillowy, with the additional flavor and texture of the almonds and delicious nuggets of corn. The sauce complemented everything and tied it all together. 

At this point I was full, but I couldn't resist dessert. So I ordered the Caramel Apple Cheesecake. It was divine!

The service was really great and I left feeling like I over-ate, but it was 100% worth it.
author: Liz S.

description:
I'm giving Urban Tavern a rounded up 3 1/2 stars, primarily for their very friendly front-of-house staff and their appetizing food presentation and overall ambiance.

The Urban Tavern is in the middle of the Hilton on O'Farrell, right at the edge of the Tenderloin and Union Square. It's a visually appealing space with lots of Edison bulbs and clean lines with modern, efficient yet warm design. The staff is friendly, attentive and flexible and pushed this from a 3 1/2 to a 4-star review for me.

After making reservations during GDC for a group of 3 at 8 p.m., we showed up about 15 minutes late with two additional dinner guests in tow. Apologizing, we hoped they could still seat us. The hostess was extremely friendly and accommodating, telling us it was no big deal and seating us immediately. 

Our waitstaff service was good and attentive, although seemed a little inexperienced. We ordered an assortment of appetizers and everyone enjoyed what was offered, especially the braised octopus and the chicken meatballs. 

We ordered a bottle of Ghost Pines cab, which needed to open up. The restaurant didn't have a decanter so we were stuck drinking it as is. Given the location in San Francisco with a well-promoted executive chef and foodie-friendly menu choices, I would have thought a decanter was a no-brainer. Especially since wine choices range from about $20 to several hundred dollars per bottle.

For the main courses, we ordered an assortment of dishes - bolognese pasta (which is made of "melted" short rib rather than the more common pork-venison-beef), burgers and steak. All were okay with no major complaints, but also not really mind-blowing considering the price. My bolognese was quite bland. A little pepper and salt helped, but still not come anywhere close to the home cooked version I prefer. 

In summary, I'd give this a 4 1/2 for service (with a small ding for the lack of decanter), a 3 1/2 for the food -- appetizers quite good, main courses just falling short -- and a 2 1/2 for pricing (considering the food quality).
author: Mario K.

description: Good dining experience, food was tasty and service was great.  Lots of options including vegetarian.  I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious the dessert was.  My favorite was the carrot cake- a lovely little piece of yummy art!
author: R A.

description:
Decided to check this place after a long time seeing it at the Hilton and assuming it was too expensive.

It was not (just regular SF prices), and a very nice perk is the parking validation with the Hilton garage of $10 for 5 hours, in an area where it is very hard to find parking.

The food was great and had surprising twists. I had the burger, and it was very, very good, with some sweet pickles that really made the difference, and very well made French fries. My friend got a tasty bisque with a touch of lime that made it special.

The decor and ambiance are great, too. Kudos for the mesmerizing light-chalk drawing on the front sidewalk.

We didn't have time and room for cocktails and desserts but then options on the menu looked very enticing.
author: Rodrigo B.

description:
Great high casual restaurant. 

My wife and I were staying at the Hilton Union Square for our anniversary and were looking for a quality, not too expensive place for dinner.  After searching on yelp and viewing all the menus this place landed on the top of our list.  I was surprised to see it was actually inside the Hilton and started to have second thoughts.  Trust me, it is not your standard hotel restaurant. 

Sebastian was our waiter. He was attentive and had a good attitude and sense of humor.  His drink recommendations were spot on. 

We had the Pork Belly & Waffle to start..WOW! This is now one of our favorite appetizers!  The pork was soft and tender with great flavor; pieces of brittle sprinkled on top all mixed with pieces of a perfectly cooked waffle. If this doesn't sound good enough, it came with Maple Bacon jelly drizzled on top of it.  again, WOW.  

For our main course we split the Urban Burger with a fried egg.  The meat was fresh & cooked perfectly. 

For drinks, my wife had the Harvest Martini, which she describes as a nice fruit drink that didn't over power with Alcohol. I had the Last Word, which was a Gin based drink.  I thought it had a good balance of botanicals and herbals and enjoyed it, where my wife said it tasted like potpourri.  I also had an Improved Whiskey, which was a good improvement on an old fashioned. 

For dessert, we had the S'mores Sundae. It was fresh marshmallow soft serve ice cream served with three roasted marshmallows, a graham cookie and sprinkled with Graham cracker and chocolate.  Another WOW!

Total cheque came to $92.00 - well worth it in our option. 

We both would highly recommend.
author: Jason H.

description: I have to admit I was somewhat hesitant to try this place out as it was inside our hotel and sometimes I find them to be more flash than substance. Yelp reviews however did not steer us wrong. This place had some of the best wait staff I have experience in a very long time. So much so that when we asked about one of the deserts he emphatically stated that we did not want to order it and it was in fact listed as a natural disaster. Definitely appreciated the frank and honest opinion. The vegetarian dish was positively a dream, with Jasmine rice risotto at the bottom and a wonderful assortment of shiitake mushrooms, bean sprouts, julienned carrots, thinly sliced marinated cucumbers, kamichi, wilted spinach with gently fried egg on the top. My dining companion ordered the pork loin which had the best flavor marinade seasoning and cooked to perfection. I would make an effort to come to this restaurant again even if I were not staying at the hotel!
author: RJ C.

description: The food was great but the service was amazing.  Our server KJ was the best.  She was the best and had an excellent knowledge of the menu and the pairings of foods.
author: Ellie S.

description: Overall I liked my salad and the salmon was delicious. A little loud, would appreciate a slightly more diverse menu, service was fine. As a note it's an 'Asian inspired', creative. Tried the octopus and thought it was ok but not the best. Thought they incorrectly labeled the beer flight.
author: Olivia G.

description:
Had an AMAZING time at Urban Tavern last night! We had the Octopus, Burrata Salad, and bread w/ honey butter...all SO good. I ordered the Bolognese which was definitely the best I've ever had. My friends got the salmon, which also looked wonderful. 

On top of the amazing food- this place also has amazing service. I left my wallet there after having too many garden path cocktails (oops) and Daniel swooped it up and kept it safe. T god for you Daniel!
author: Lindsay D.

description: A really nice place. A short but diverse menu with California style flavor. Great staff. Good wine and beer choices. Fair prices. Right near a few hotels. Decor is modern and seating is varied--- we ate at the high round bar style table for two and it was comfortable.
author: Denis F.

description: The small plates and desserts were delicious.  We had the octopus, pork belly & animal style waffles, and pimento cheese with fire roasted chips.  Service excellent.
author: George S.

description: First time here and we came before the theater. Not overly crowded and was peaceful. The lighting was dim, but you could still see well enough. Servers were friendly and helpful. We had the charred Spanish octopus for an appetizer, which was done perfectly with chorizo, mushrooms, asparagus and sweety drop peppers. For main dishes we shared the 8 hour bolognese and the burrata salad. Both were tasty. The bolognese was excellent it was just the right amount on the pasta with fantastic flavor. The burrata salad was good although it seemed to have too much of the vinaigrette dressing on it. We did switch out the mesclun for arugula, but I don't think that was the reason why. For dessert we went with the berry bomb and let's just say...it did not disappoint. Sweet and just the right size. Location, atmosphere and service was great. I'd come back and recommend to others.
author: Dara M.

description:
It's the holidays and I was in the mood for a traditional meal something out of a Charles Dickens novel so I decided to go here for dinner.

The chicken dish was exactly what I was looking for. It's a roasted hen. It's delicious and takes you back to a time when quality food existed. The milk bread is also incredible, like something from another time. 

You must try this meal.
author: Amethyst P.

description: I ate at the bar and may have been working off a limited menu.  Solid but unexceptional.   Nice squash bisque.  Very good -- if incredibly greasy -- burger.  Nice bar, great bartenders.  Nice ambiance and an attractive setting.  I'd come again -- particularly when the Hilton next door goes nuts for a convention or such.  In that case it can serve as a very pleasant oasis as it did for me.
author: Dave K.

description: Really good food. The Line-Caught California Black Cod was delicious! Also had the Burrata salad as an appetizer which was so good.
author: Alexis L.

description:
Urban Tavern creates the same modern atmosphere many hotel restaurants have; minimal lighting, lounge music, it's safe, it's inoffensive, & you're certainly not experiencing SF's new gastropub culture by dining here. That being said, the bartender made a good dirty martini & my $29 Garganelli Pasta Bolognese looked & tasted lovely. Short rib made up the bolognese, which was an unexpected twist on "sauce." "Micro feathered aged goat cheese" had a delicate texture, the shavings barely melting over the dish, but gave a tangy, flavorful finish to each bite. 

I wouldn't have thought to pick this restaurant myself, but I enjoyed dinner here. 

Thank you to the staff who quickly accommodated our large party with an extra table when more people than anticipated showed up.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Great service and incredible suggestions on the meal .. thank you KJ for a great night
author: Cameron F.

description:
Good , calfornia style menu
Fairly expensive for portions
Two people 1 drink each $115  with tip for dinner
Good sirloin strip and vegetables  my wife had salad with sirloin strip
author: Joe B.

description: Happy hour is excellent. Try the short rib tacos and peppers. Cool ambiance and nice, down-to-earth bartenders.
author: S T.

description:
I liked the decor and the service was attentive. But the restaurant stayed pretty empty even on a Friday night. 

Overall impression was that everything was way overpriced and kind of lacked substance. The food was plated really nicely but flavors were standard and nothing was particularly standout. I got the spring vegetable salad with halibut and the halibut was like a tiny 2x2" square for an extra $13! The "salad" itself was probably like three veggies (radish, small potato, or small radish -- I think??) cut into quarters. I did steal a fry or two from my friend and I thought they were well seasoned, cooked just right, and paired with tasty aioli. I didn't really try any of the other food so I can't comment though my other friend did mention the pasta was overly salty.

Shrug. There are better places you could be going to...
author: Liza X.

description:
TL;DR - Decent ambiance and food, meh service, but fantastic dessert.

Went to take advantage of Restaurant Week, which made a usually expensive meal a pretty good deal. I can't speak to any of the cocktails or drinks, but the food was pretty decent! Would definitely recommend the pimento cheese dip and the s'mores sundae. Service was spotty - it seemed like they were understaffed - and I wasn't a huge fan of the horse statue. But a decent place to eat if you're willing to splurge a little.
author: Mia F.

description: The staff in this restaurant were some of the rudest I interacted with in the city.  The place was clean, the burger was descent, and the fries were delicious.  But the staff left a horrible taste in my mouth.  Please learn something from the cleaning staff in the hotel.  They could teach you something about customer service.
author: F C.

description:
The menu is somewhat limited. There are "smalls" and "not so smalls" and the choices within those two categories is limited to about 8 choices. Enough for some people, but not everyone.

I got the pork tenderloin which was cooked to the doneness that I requested and I had no complaints. Tender, flavorful, and I'd order it again. Another person at the table ordered the Bolognese (which I tasted, it was good)  and he raved about it a day later so that's a good option too. 

The prices are a little above average but not crazy expensive given the location. The portions are large enough that you can probably get by with just an entree and no starter.
author: D E.

description:
Terrible service! Inattentive and absent minded. You're wrong if you'd think you can justify it with the food quality and taste. 
Just another spot downtown with low quality service and food for tourists. Nothing authentic!
author: Taraneh G.

description: Where do I begin? KJ that's where!! We came in for a quick appetizer and I was blown away with her knowledge, descriptions and intelligence around the menu. It may sound odd, but once you experience KJ- you'll know what I'm talking about. She is a stand out in every way. The food matched her delicious descriptions too. We had the shisto peppers, corn succotash, pimento cheese dip and the smash fries. Yumminess all around.
author: Carrie R.

description:
I finally decided to try Urban Tavern after running out of 'local options' as it was so close to the Hilton Hotel Union Square (I come to San Fran at least once a month); that is my mistake - I should have tried Urban Tavern from the beginning!
I sat at the bar so service was prompt. Ginger Smash cocktail was very good and professionally prepared every time (yes I may have had more than a couple). All meals were fresh and tasty. Bartenders are friendly so feel free to ask or state your preferences (I should have taken this advice earlier to save me from finding out that Fresno sauce tastes like Buffalo Sauce - I hate Buffalo Sauce (I know I am in the minority here) but the chicken meatballs was still very good even with the aforementioned sauce).
One thing I really like about UT, they keep the same menu items but just put a different flair which to me is a good thing.
I also observed others around me and how they were treated and the service standards were consistent. 
I will always put Urban Tavern as a place to eat when I come to San Fran, it is now a 'local', hip place to dine.
author: Andrew C.

description: We spend every other Thanksgiving weekend in San Francisco to watch The Irish play The Cardinal. This year we happen to be here on Thanksgiving so I was looking for a resturaunt serving a "Traditional Thanksgiving Dinner". I was very pleased to receive a call from The Urban Tavern confirming their availability for a reservation and the dinner menu. On top of the food being to die for, both the Resturaunt Manager (Miriam) and General Manager (Daniel) checked on us several times and made us feel like VIPs. The Urban Tavern in the Hilton Union Square is not the typical hotel resturaunt. Do yourself a favor and stop into The Urban Tavern and check it out. Just another good reason to always stay with the Hilton family. GO IRISH!!!!
author: Nick P.

description: Sebastian is awesome! Very attentive, great recommendations and hilarious! The wine selection is grand and the appetizers were very tasty!!
author: Adria P.

description:
This restaurant was a little disappointing.

Pros:
Nice restaurant
Pork belly waffle appetizer was very good.
Service was decent. 

Cons: 
Ramen- literally, the .99 cent ramen you can get from any grocery store has triple the flavor of the ramen here. It was soooo bland. The pork belly in it was good. Even after I mixed that paste in, it was still very watery. 
My bf got the burger, and I could tell he didn't care for it, he only ate half of it. He said the caramelized onions in the burger were way too strong.
author: Liza K.

description: I used to come here all the time when I lived in the area.  Since moving I have to say that I really miss it.  The food here is pretty good.  I really like how is really is a mixing pot of flavors, really embracing the essence of the local culture.   I really enjoy ordering off of the small bites sections of the menu.  The item that I always order and love, the kimchi french fries!
author: Claire A.

description:
Love the location. It's in the heart of the city. Easy reservation over the phone. 
The food was great. Excellent service and the chef even came out to  talk to us. Will come back here anytime. 
Appetizer, we ordered the pimiento cheese spread and peppers.
the skirt steak  and   pasta with bolognese were delicious.  Some  of the people in our group ordered the  burger which was great.
Everyone had a great time.
author: Maria M.

description: If you're lucky enough to have KJ as your server let her order for you and you won't be disappointed.  We had butter bread, a kimchi appetizer, and an octopus appetizer.  All delicious!  My husband had the hamburger and I had rock fish.  Both outstanding and my husband is extremely picky about what constitutes a good burger.  Urban Tavern is the place to go after going to the theater or just spending a day in the city.  Great experience overall!  Who knew?!
author: Sharon G.

description: Urban tavern is a restaurant attached I believed to a Hilton. You can sit at the bar, a more casual from area or a more remote tight knit area in the back of the restaurant. Our waiter was a very friendly older gentleman that was very attentive with our orders, the food was good, cocktails were phenomenal but it is a bit pricey ... I'm not from San Fran so I guess that's expected for this type of restaurant.
author: Faye K.

description: The food was awesome!  But the best part was the AMAZING waitress KJ.  She was very attentive and made the experience!  I would highly recommend!!
author: Doug S.

description: The food was great but the best part of the experience was KJ. She was super attentive, predicted our needs, was friendly and fun, and had great recommendations. You'll leave with a fuller belly and if you sit with KJ you'll also leave with a giant smile on your face!
author: Heather R.

description: The service was good, but the food was a huge disappointment. We ordered the kimchi fries, charred spanish octopus, and the pastrami spiced pork tenderloin. Out of the 3, the kimchi fries were were delicious. However, I think the chef got the name wrong. The dish was full of potato wedges, not thinly sliced fries, so I think this dish should be renamed. The charred spanish octopus about average. It wasn't a horrible dish, but it wasn't memorable either. The pastrami spiced pork tenderloin was the worst of the 3. It really tasted like a heavily salted ham, with the salt outbalancing the surrounding flavors.
author: Phil S.

description: I decided to eat here due to it being at my hotel. I made the right choice. When you walk in, you'll notice a hipster atmosphere. It's not bad or anything, but you might not expect it. The menu might also come of as strange for people who aren't used to very hipster style food. Luckily, I'm used to it. I ordered the 8 hour bolognese. When they slow cook tagliatelle for 8 hours, you know that it's gonna be good! It was surprisingly one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had! Plus, the fries are OUTSTANDING (I tried my dad's fries). However, DO NOT SKIP DESSERT! All of them are incredible. I got the Coconut-Guava Roche. It's basically coconut and guava mousse with bits of tapioca and gelatin. It was AWESOME! So was my brother's S'mores Sundae (marshmallow flavoured ice cream with toasted marshmallows and graham crackers) and my parents' Carrot Cake (not what you'd expect a carrot cake to look like, but don't let it fool you!)! I will have to recommend Urban Tavern to everyone I know. You'll love it!
author: Ethan W.

description: One of the best experiences I've had in a very long time. I had the bolognese and it was extremely flavorful. I think my favorite part of the experience was our waitress KJ she was an absolute delight. I wish every waitress was like her.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Went last night with my hubby. So glad we had a reservation as it was packed.
We liked the atmosphere and really great service - 5 stars for the server we had last night. He was so amazing. I have to eat GF and he was wonderful at giving me a custom menu of items to choose from.
We each ordered cocktails. Age of Avion which I really enjoyed and The Garden Path which my husband felt resembled a gimlet.
I had a really nice squash bisque. It was good and could have been a little hotter. It was warm but needed a little more turning up on the temp for my liking. I loved how they had all items separate in the bowl and then they poured the liquid portion of the bisque over upon serving.
For the main I had Chinook Salmon - I only wish it had more of the carrot-ginger purée which was astar on that plate. My husband had the Roasted Jidori "Peking" Chicken which he said was over salted (skin) if he took off the skin he was able to eat it otherwise. 
My husband also ordered Caramel Apple Cheesecake for dessert. It was so cute when it arrived. He took a photo which I will have to get and upload later.It looked like a little green apple on a plate but when you cut into it, you get the pieces of apple and the cheesecake.
author: Kelly M.

description: I was initially leery about going to a hotel bar but the ambience was great, the cocktail delicious and the food divine! We shared the small octopus plate, suggested by our bartender, and the burrata salad. The salad had some prosciutto, grilled nectarines and little toasts. Everything was super delicious!
author: Brumhilda M.

description: If I could give more I would. Came here to watch head over heels at the Curran. What a great spot to grab dinner and drinks before the show. The staff just set the tone for an amazing night. The bartender Anthony knows his drinks. Our waiter Victor was so attentive and gave great recommendation on the food. The food was stellar. We had the milk bread, cheese dip, Peking chicken and the beef. Visually beautiful and delicious. Ignore the negative comments the food, decor and location matches the price point. The manager forgot his name was also friendly. Will definitely come back
author: Kat V.

description:
Food was very average or below average.  We had two shaved Brussel sprout salads and two Ramen means.  For a place that is hot and new it was very disappointing.

Service was good and atmosphere was also good.

Food was luckluster and bland.
author: Peter B.

description: The. Worst. Place. Ever! Avoid at all cost! Walking into the restaurant you think it would be decent, not a bad vibe and full of people. We get seated right away and then that is the end of all good things. It took them around 30 minutes to get water! Then another 30 minutes to get welcomed by our sever. He was the worst server ever! He did not introduce himself at all. He asked us for drinks and that was it. He didn't ask if we wanted appetizers or anything. I asked for a cocktail and my boyfriend a beer. My boyfriend got his beer rather quickly but my drink took another 30 minutes to get to me. Once I go it the drink tasted like water downed alcohol. Seriously?! Clearly the bartender sucked! At the end of it all I drank was water (which wasn't what I came for). Another 30 minutes passed and the waiter came around to take our order, he was so lost, didn't write anything down and asked several times to repeat the order. Yet another 30 minutes to pass before we got our food. The food was nothing special and tasted like nothing special. The only thing that was actually good was the fries (I kid you not). Continuing on with the bad service, our waiter never came around to check on us, asked us how the food was and if we needed anything else. We had to flag him down twice. We asked for another order of fries and yes another 30 minutes passed and by that time we were done eating and no longer wanted the fries order. Our waiter told the waitress that was bringing the fries order that we no longer wanted them and she such an attitude - not OK! We asked for the dessert menu and again it was nothing special.  The entire bill was $80. And the guy got a $10 tip. It was so close to talking to the manager but lacked the patience to do so. Yes this place was busy but that doesn't mean you should lack good customer service by any means. Because of this I WILL NOT BE COMING HERE AGAIN!!!!
author: Anne R.

description:
My husband and I were attending a play on Geary and wanted a place to grab a bite beforehand. This place had some great reviews and it definitely lived up to them. I realized after we got there that we were actually in a hotel restaurant. You would never know it when you enter off of O'Farrell. You definitely would not guess it based upon the food quality, service and prices. 
We ordered the Burrata salad, pork belly and waffle and the urban burger and shared. The pork belly and waffle being an appetizer was not huge, but was very delicious. I loved the salad, it had delicious peaches, fresh mozzarella and prosciutto. The burger was cooked exactly as ordered. The bacon jam was tasty, but have them leave it off if you don't like sweet with your meat. We were too full to try desert, but would definitely give it a go.
Service was impeccable.
author: Sheri G.

description: I tried to like this place a lot more than I did. Bar service was good enough. The dinner menu is eclectic bar food. I had a burger. Others in our party had appetizers. One of our party changed his order but the waitress didn't get it right. Then spent the rest of dinner apologizing. I doubt I'll be back.
author: Harold G.

description: The food was good. Wait staff was nice. Atmosphere was nice, not too loud. Prices were a little high.
author: Vel R.

description:
The Peking chicken was delicious!  I felt as though I was eating a dish fresh from a gourmet restaurant in China (yes, I've done that, too). The ginger flavors with the black bean sauce and perfectly cooked chicken left lovely aromas lingering on my palate. We also enjoyed the chocolate mousse desert, the delicious cafe americanos, the bell pepper crisps with pimento cheese, and the burger. We are considering a second visit to this restaurant before returning home. 

Oh, and our server was wonderful and had an amazing personality!  He left smiles on our faces (and our neighbor table as well)!
author: R. D.

description: I was in San Francisco overnight & I discovered this on Yelp! It happened to be across the street from my hotel. I was my server's (Hailey) 1st customer & everything was great! I loved the pimento cheese with red pepper crisps. Also, the smashed fries were divine - they practically melted in my mouth! The decor was both relaxed & hip! Several yummy dessert selections too...!!
author: Heather B.

description:
I had the pork tenderloin and my wife had the crab soup and smashed fries. The tenderloin was cooked to order and had a really good flavor, as did the asparagus that came with it. The potato puffs that came with it were rather bland and tasteless for something that was supposed to be cooked with cheese.

My wife's soup was good, but the smashed fries were just so-so.

Presentation on everything was very nice, but the portions were a little on the small side and the menu was very limited in selection. Wait staff was friendly and service was prompt. Not someplace that I'd seek out when I was in town.
author: Ed M.

description: The Spanish Optus is so good! I will recommend this dish! The grilled chicken is tasty with very crispy skin! The seating is comfortable. They served food fast enough! Ginger ale is spicy enough! I feel very good about this place! Good for group as wells!
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Wine, appetizers,  and entrees were amazing.  The pork tenderloin was incredible and we had the most amazing server KJ.  Job well done!
author: Rich V.

description: This place is great!  Food is great and great drinks ideas!  Will come back!  The peppers have a lot of flavor.
author: Ray B.

description: Nice folks. A bit pricey. Burger was a burger. Nothing so special that it's beyond normal. Fries were limp and most, not crisp. Bar staff is friendly and good.
author: Scott H.

description: Late night dinner tonight. Found this near our Hilton hotel. Sebastian gave us great service. Especially like that we had an option of a 'glass and a half' size of wine, as we'd been tasting all day and a bottle was too much.  The shishito peppers were the best we've ever had, and we followed it with the Shio ramen.   Comfort food!
author: Ray F.

description:
There's a new chef in town...
Needed something close to the hotel and man did we luck out!  Apparently they (the new chef) are using the same/similar menus with a few minor tweaks.  
My party had the gourmet burger medium rare -- one of the best damn burgers I have had in years!  It was a little pricy and a tiny bit messy (couldn't keep the beef stake tomato in one place) but damn it was delicious!  Do order it with the smash fries if you want to top off your pallet.  Put this on your list!
author: Allan B.

description: Really great service but I was kinda underwhelmed by the food. Conceptually the food was amazing, i.e. cooking chicken in Peking duck style and the plating was nice but I was overall not amazed with the taste. We ordered the Peking duck chicken, octopus appetizer, Bolognese, and a salad (I can't remember which one). The octopus and salad were good but the bolognese was just ok, nothing special about it, and I thought the chicken was a little dry and the sides it came with were too salty. For dessert we got the caramel apple cheesecake and the s'mores sundae. Both came out looking super beautiful and well plated, just like the savory dishes, but I wasn't wowed by the taste. The caramel apple cheesecake didn't quite have the texture of cheesecake and kinda tasted like perfume. The s'mores sundae was ok but the marshmallows which were toasted were actually quite stiff and not how fire toasted marshmallows should be. All in all I wouldn't go out of my way to go back to this restaurant.
author: Taline M.

description: Alright this place is awesome, everything we ordered (Burger,Sashimi,Chicken Breast,Cauliflower Steak) was well done and tasty. I would definitely come back, I had the burger and was very satisfied with it. The main reason I rated 'Urban Tavern' 4 stars is the unique menu selection. This will prohibit some customers because they will be scared to try it. My advice is to come in and try something new. The alcohol selection is huge and has plenty of selections. THIS IS NOT A KID FRIENDLY PLACE. They will have a hard time finding something to eat. But besides that this place was very good and would highly recommend it.
author: Evan H.

description:
Great food, friendly / knowledgeable wait staff, convenient location...it was an accidental find, but we'll be back. To begin with, our server - KJ - was nothing short of amazing. There are great servers...and then there's KJ -- she's in a class all by herself. There were six of us for dinner and we had 8-hour Bolognese, Chinook Salmon, and the Wine Bottle Roasted Biagio Chicken. Each dish was better than the next. And for dessert, we all ordered (on KJ's recommendation) the Berry Bomb (raspberry chantilly | strawberry and ginger beer consume | yuzu creme brulee buttons). It is one of the most unusual - but delicious - desserts any of us has ever chanced upon. 
We cannot recommend this restaurant enough.
author: Jeff B.

description: What an amazing service and great food... visiting from FL for 3 days .. had breakfast every day and one dinner ...  every server, host and manager specially Mr. Namer ... I was in the hospitality business 15 years ago and i know what service is all about... I love how professional they are and caring for your need..Great job guys .. I miss the true hospitality service.. whatever you ask for they will deliver. Job well done... Bravo
author: Rod A.

description:
Poor experience and overpriced food for the quality.  The sour Dough was very dry and difficult to eat with little flavor.  The ramen noodle bowl wasn't terrible but any noodle place can do better and at reasonable prices.  The burger was good size but for $21 we would expect it cooked to order, with decent flavor, and not to fall apart after first bite.  

Long story short we would never recommend this place to anyone based in price, quality, and meal flavor.
author: Chris G.

description: The Theatre dinner and parking package was a great value. The best was the dessert - apple cheesecake.  Our server KJ recommended this since one of the items on the Theatre menu was no longer available.  Both the apple cheesecake and the 7 layer chocolate cake should be added to the Theatre menu. We will be back again!
author: Bonnie B.

description: This place is amazing! Food is delicious, I'v got bruschetta salad and it was delicious, my friend got Peking duck also excellent. The best part was our waitress, very knowledgeable and professional! Try apple dessert you will not regret it:)
author: Daria M.

description: We had the Octopus, chicken meatballs and bolognese, recommended by our wonderful waiter Sebastian (because we had a hard time deciding what to eat because everything sounded pretty good), food was really good especially the octopus , and service was wonderful. Little more pricey but the food was worth it.
author: Caro A.

description: A thoroughly enjoyable meal. We started with well crafted cocktails, shared the Burrata Salad and the Brandt Beef Skirt Steak with a side of wild mushrooms, then finished with coffee and the Berry Bomb. The steak was cooked perfectly (medium rare).  Service was friendly and professional. We would definitely come back.
author: Diane S.

description: We stopped in for appetizers before dinner reservations at another restaurant.  Food was great, drinks were fantastic, and the bartender Greg was great for conversation! Two thumbs up!!
author: Tara And Sean W.

description: They're conveniently located in the Hilton Union Square so if you stay there it's a must try... the food was splendid!!  The service was perfect & so was the reception.  This was a perfect ending to our last day!!  I'll definitely be back to try other dishes...
author: Diana J.

description: Pleasantly surprised by Urban Tavern. Our server was so friendly and attentive, and gave us great recommendations. Nice ambiance, especially in the section nearest the bar. Food was fantastic and creative. We had the chicken meatballs and octopus as starters and then I had the pork chop and my dining companions had the burger and roasted chicken. All highly recommended!
author: Katherine B.

description: Found this nice little treasure tonight just by looking on YELP. I don't understand the 3 star rating. This place was excellent! The brussel sprout salad was heavenly. Seriously, I will dream of it tonight. The wild mushrooms were scrumptious. My friend and I both had the ramen. It was really good too. The chef even came out and greeted us. The Spanish waiter was top notch. He gave us recommendations and made us laugh. Bravo! We will return for sure.
author: Raeme K.

description: Came here for our last dinner of 2016. They took our reservation and were able to seat us a bit early. Fun menu for cocktails and our dinner was delicious. We had the skirt steak with mushrooms and I was so happy. The wait staff was also friendly and didn't skip a beat. I recommend this spot if you are in Union Square and look for a hip place to eat. Prices were not crazy expensive considering the area.
author: Yvonne G.

description: The cuisine here met or even surpassed any Michelin star restaurant I've eaten at, Chef Michael came out to greet the guests and explain his menu. Absolutely unlike your typical hotel restaurant. We had the poke salad, octopus, greens, brussel sprout salad, pork chop and chicken. Nothing we ordered fell into the category of mediocre. Sebastian our server was excellent. This is bar-none, one of the up and comers in San Fran. My hats off to you Chef. Hands down, a well deserved 5 star rating.
author: Ann K.

description: We are staying at the hotel Hilton right next door, and we wanted to find a place where underaged people can eat while the adults drank some cocktails. The dessert that we were given was presented very nicely and looked very appealing. The Crunchy Cayenne Chocolate Mousse was spicy while also having a "chocolaty" and sweet fruit options to balance it out. The S'mores Sundae was very good (according to the younger ones) and looked extremely appealing. The waiter was super kind and made jokes when he took our order. The environment is super friendly and inviting.
author: Jannai W.

description: Really enjoyed our meal at Urban Tavern The Barratta salad with quinoa and goat cheese was superb.  One of my daughters had the Pork Belly with Waffle and my eldest daughter had the Urban Burger.  According to them, they were both excellent.  The ingredients in my salad were organic, locally sourced and delicious.  The desserts were absolutely ridiculous though.  Fresh berries with marscapone, and the blackberry gelato was amazing.  Service from Sebastian was absolutely top notch, responsive and engaging.  He provided really great recommendations.  Will definitely be coming back!
author: Bill H.

description: Went there with a couple of buddies and had 3 appetisers which all were pretty average at best. The octopus we actually had to return. Very disappointing.
author: Steve G.

description: Ordered the Urban Burger x 3 myself my wife and my son meal was fantastic !!! service was even better!!!  Had to add the egg to the Burger since I've never had a duck egg I went with the chicken! Definitely will be coming back
author: Mike C.

description: Food and service was great. I would highly recommend the Halibut, lentils and mushrooms. I would definitely recommend for dinner!
author: Pez P.

description: The service was good and attentive. The server checked in on us and was very friendly. The food was tasty overall. I ordered the pork chop and my friend ordered the bolognese, and we shared the brownie and panna cotta. My pork chop was pretty good. It was seared nicely and had a nice flavor. My only issue was that at least a quarter to a third of the pork chop was fat. I don't know much about cuts of meat. Perhaps that is just how pork chops are. The accompanying vegetables of brussel sprous and sweet potatoes, and the surprising addition of pork rinds were also very good - seasoned properly and cooked nicely. My friend's bolognese was good, but I thought the meat was a little tough. The actual brownie and panna cotta were good, but it had a strange assortment of fruits, candies, and flowers on top that were not. They did not go well with the actual desserts and actually detracted from them. The brownie itself was crisp on the outside and slightly gooey in the middle. The panna cotta had two fruity flavors - one strawberry and the other I'm not sure about. It was unexpected, but not bad.
author: Annie L.

description: The food was phenomenal! I had the pork tenderloin and it was exceptional. My partner had the ramen and she was in heaven. The portion is huge! We split the cotton cheesecake and it was to die for! The service was great! We will be back!
author: Carla M.

description: Went here expecting high standards based on other reviews. We had the san fran restaurant week promotion, we arrived at 7.30pm on a monday and were immediately told that the cheesecake dessert was sold out. So we ordered the chocolate mousse at the beginning of the meal with all the other courses. By the time we got to our desserts we were then told that the chocolate mousse was out and we were very rudely told that our options were an assortment of gelato or a sundae. We spoke with the manager to no end. I got the sundae and it came without the cinnamon cracker. So basically i got a bland milk flavored ice cream with some chocolate bits and huge 1/4 charred smores. A sundae at mcdonalds would be better. So terrible service and poor food. Worst dining experience in san fran to date.
author: Mark T.

description: In the Hilton Hotel, so close option when staying here.  Service was quick and nice.  Menu a bit limited for dinner and only a few items that jumped out at me.  Tried the 8 hour bolognese and was very pleased.  Portion size was goid and excellent flavor.  Atmosphere was good, not too loud or packed in.  Prices were moderate to high, but to be expected in this area.
author: Chris H.

description:
So.  Good.

Visiting San Fran and I followed the suggestions of others on yelp and tried it for my self.  Great ambiance, Fantastic food!  I will be back tomorrow - it's that good!
author: Brigid L.

description:
Seated quickly, good service.

Food was ok and quite overpriced. It's not terrible, but certainly not worth your time when so many other great options are available in this area.
author: Quentyn Z.

description:
I am a local, and came before a show up the block on Geary, with relatively low expectations, and I thought the place was really good. Not many people there on a Saturday night, but my visit was great. I wanted a small salad (not on the menu) and they brought out a lovely small salad, with greens and tomatoes, very nicely dressed. I then had the flank steak with chimichurri sauce and it was delicious and perfectly prepared.

Nice meal!
author: Peter S.

description: Delicious food and Sebastian will take care of you and make sure you enjoy yourself. Listen to his recommendations because they are delicious. Will definitely be back.
author: Kristal B.

description: We were staying at the hotel and thought we would grab a quick, light dinner before our show.  Our waiter, Josue, was a gem.  Very personable, attentive and fun.   He took great care of us.  The food was delicious.  We will definitely stop by again.
author: Karen K.

description: We came here with a large work group of about 15 people.  They managed the group very well, the food came out on time, all together and they were incredibly personable and friendly.  The atmosphere is well done and comfortable. I had the pork which was recommended and  unbelievable as the waitress, KJ, said it would be.  Also notable was the sorbet we had for dessert - quite sublime.
author: Ken W.

description: Definitely try Urban Tavern. We had an amazing dinner. Steak and Halibut were delicious. Ask for Sebastian, he is an amazing waiter. He will take care of you and guide you through the menu.
author: Ceren M.

description: I was really looking forward to a nice dinner to celebrate our 25th year anniversary. This restaurant was very disappointing. Everything we ordered was extremely greasy. I ordered the roasted jidori "Peking" chicken dinner and my husband ordered the pork belly and waffle. My husband is asking me to give it a 2 stars but I'll give it 3 for their good customer service also the restaurant is very nice and clean.
author: Noah V.

description: We just had dinner before a show at the Curran. Great place. Solid food. Great ambiance. But I'm writing to compliment the service. One of us did not like our entree and the dining manager came to ask what happened when she heard from our server we complained. She was attentive and offered us a complimentary dessert, which we declined.  So she took the entree off our check. Then when we left we forgot a pair of prescription glasses. We were half a block down the street when our server caught up with us. So they get a full five stars from us.
author: Emily A.

description: We went to the Urban Tavern for dinner last night before the theater.  We were running late and the Urban Tavern was closer to the Exit Stage Left Theater than the restaurant that we had originally selected.  Wow! What a delicious surprise! I expected a basic (boring) chain-hotel food experience.  I was resigned to eating something small and generic just to avoid a rumbling stomach during the 2 hour show.  Well, we're we surprised! We had one of the most outstanding and delicious (and memorable) meals I can remember last night at the Urban Tavern.  Our lovely, efficient, bright star of a server, a 20 year happy veteran of the Hilton who calls herself "K.J." was a delight!  She explained each dish accurately and beautifully.  We loved the burrata salad, the mushroom medley side dish, the outstanding "pastrami-style" pork loin and a yummy red blend wine from their very ample menu.  The dishes are clean yet complex.  The ingredients are locally sourced.  The dishes were artfully composed and unique.  We loved everything, seriously.  We can't wait to return to try the apple inspired cheesecake the KJ so carefully described.  The Urban Tavern has not yet been discovered by many -- perhaps it suffers from less enthusiastic reviews by diners who ate there before the arrival of the current chef. It t is a fantastic restaurant and we will be back!
author: Adela C.

description: I absolutely loved my experience here tonight! Fun & fancy drinks and amazing food too. I got the melon margarita and the urban burger with the egg & avocado. Perfect way to begin a night out on the town in San Francisco. Highly recommend & Sebastian is a hoot! Enjoy!!
author: Ashley B.

description: Found this place within close walking distance of our hotel on Union Square.  I think it's attached to the  Hilton, but has its own entrance so it doesn't feel like a hotel restaurant.  We're always looking for restaurants with great food and atmosphere that aren't so stuffy that we can't bring out sons, ages seven and ten, and this place was perfect.  Hostess was very friendly and welcoming.  Our server Josue was excellent, very friendly and attentive and great with the kids.  In fact, my older son suggested this five star review after he stopped by to check on us.  The Burrata salad plus salmon and the sweet potato gnocchi were both delicious.  They actually have a kids menu that keeps it simple and the boys loved the grilled cheese and burger.  Beer and wine list were great with lots of good choices.  All in all, a great place.  Highly recommended!
author: David P.

description: Great dinner. I had the pork loin which was tender and had an excellent taste. Followed up with the waiter recommended gluten free chocolate mousse and a glass if great port. Sebastian was our server his recommendations were great, service was good and I loved his personality. Probably will go again before this trip is over
author: Pat M.

description: I ordered the cauliflower "steak" and a glass of moderately priced red wine. The wine was delicious. So they've got that going for them. My dinner was literally just a giant head of cauliflower with a splash of ragout on top and a handful of roasted vegetables. Seriously. Just a giant piece of cauliflower. For $24. Do you have any idea how much cauliflower I could get for $24? I don't even know, because it's so much. How did that get on the menu? Seriously, try the Rutherford cabernet, though.
author: Russ H.

description: Wow!   Possibly the best meal I have ever had.  The ahi poké was superb.  The sauce under the fish was otherworldly.  Sebastian was so dope.  Brought us beautiful, fresh-squeezed lemon drops and was basically our best friend by the time we left.  The rest of our food was so good, fresh, healthy.  Amazing.  THIS is fine dining in San Francisco.
author: Liana S.

description: Superb service! Amazing food.  We had a group of 14 that just got out of a show! They accommodated  us, assigned two servers and had marvelous food! Great spot!
author: Jonathan L.

description: Just had dinner at urban tavern and it was delicious. I had the octopus which was cooked to perfection. Octopus was recommended by the server Sebastian. Also had the bolognese and the chicken meatballs which were very good as well. The food was good but the service was even better
author: William M.

description: They have a new chef and it's a great improvement!  The food is enjoyable with nice presentation.   My favorite is the Burrata salad with salmon.  The salmon is perfectly prepared and tastes amazing.  A nightly special or regular updates to the menu would be welcomed.
author: Christine F.

description: Had the fried chicken special. It had a pickle brine and was tasty! It was paired up with the best cornbread I've ever had, not dry! Great job!
author: Joseph B.

description:
My wife and I were in San Francisco for business, staying at the Hilton and decided to try Urban Tavern.  The first time we went we were pleasantly surprised to experience world-class food and service.  Literally, it was far and away better than we could have even imagined and that's fairly powerful of us to say.  My wife and I appreciate and seek out great dining experiences and this was just so unexpectedly good...perhaps we were jaded in the sense that being it was attached to a chain hotel, we didn't think it would be as good as it was.  But, it WAS.

Knowing that, we came back two nights later with a business friend of ours.  That night it was equally as good and we discovered the Filet of Sole was simply one of the best interpretations of this fish classic that was literally on par with anything, anywhere we have had in the past.  The desserts were stellar, the service exemplary and the food: superlative.

Now, enter Friday, the end of the week, we'd been in presentations for three days and were just dead tired and decided, again almost on a whim, what not let's just complete the triumvirate and go to Urban.  Only this time, we went because we KNEW how good it would be.  And tonight, my friends, they simply crushed it.

The chef, Michael Raub, made us a venison platter that was on par with any we've had anywhere.  Our attentive waiter, Sebastian, was by now, recognizing us and treated us like family.  The manager, Gerald, even came by and told us a little about him and Michael and it was just a great, great time.

I'll even add a little more:  It was a magical evening.  We were tired, we were ready to get back to our room and the entire entourage attached to us utterly went to the nth degree to spoil us with fantastic service, meals that stood with the best we've ever had and individual meetings with the Chef and the Manager.  Needless to say, we quickly forgot we were tired and let the experience really soak in.  If it seems like I am a bit gushy about these folks it's because I am.  The service and the food are on par with any place we've eaten in any major city, anywhere.  The food is absolutely rock solid, the presentation equal to the product and the staff are the type of professionals every restaurant wished they had.  

I won't drill-down too deeply on individual food plates as we can safely say, if it's on the menu, it will be good.  The fish is a treat and if they have venison on the menu that night, don't hesitate to give it a shot; it is truly like butter, just melting in your mouth.

My wife and I have eaten at many a Michelin Three Star, many a world-class eatery and are no strangers to good service and good food.  But Urban Tavern is a rare, exceedingly rare treat in a downtown location in a great city that will blow your socks off.
author: Pruitt H.

description:
5 for service
4 for food
2 for prices
Bolognese was really pretty good, but the price was really high - $28 egawds.  Made with real shredded beef not ground meat so that is a plus.  Burgers ($21, $23 with egg) were huge...a bit too big to eat.  got mixed reviews - from good to dry.  steak looked excellent, but I didn't personally taste.  The vegetable dishes ie cauliflower steak for $25...ridiculous, and I don't care if it's "the city".  Barely anyone in the place which usually isn't a good sign, especially for a Friday nite. They charged an 18% gratuity - I guess because we had 6 people.  well technically 5 adults and one toddler.  Which is interesting since the service was excellent - our waiter was so lovely, and the chef came round to check on our level of contentment which is always appreciated.  I typically pay 20% tip unless service is horrible, so the built-in 18% was not a wise choice.  I don't know if I would go back with all the fabulous and expensive places in SF, and all the fabulous "finds" that offer great food for a value.
author: Kai F.

description: Went here for Sunday Brunch while I was in town for the weekend. Our server met us at the table and asked what we would like to drink. Both myself and my boyfriend asked for water and ordered the buffet and an omelette. We went and got the buffet food - by the time we got back - still no water. We asked again - 10 minutes later - still no water. The waiter never even came back to our table. Our omelettes were delivered by someone else without a word. The only time our waiter came back was to drop the check (still no water). This was the first time in my life that I did not tip a waiter, but he completely ignored us. I definitely wouldn't recommend this place for Sunday brunch. Hopefully dinner service is better.
author: CJ B.

description: My husband was in SF on business and had dinner at Urban Tavern. My husband doesn't have Yelp but wanted me to write this review on his behalf. My husband was very pleased with Urban Tavern and wanted to call out Wade specifically for the excellent customer service he received.
author: Joanna P.

description: We just finished the breakfast buffet and it is amazing. Many different choices including dim sum and bagels with lox. So many yummy options to choose from. But what really makes this restaurant stand out is the incredible staff. The general manager Bettina went far out of her way to help us and our waiter Jansen was so attentive.
author: Beth B.

description:
So glad Urban Tavern has finally reopened

We have tried the following so far:

Skirt Steak = A+ , really good steak

Candied Pork Belly = delicious!!

Shio Ramen = really good = best value

Urban Burger = really great

Pacific Sole = really good

we will definitely be going back
author: D L.

description: Very good  - we had the roasted chicken - it was wonderful.  Be sure and order the milk bread appetizer
author: Chris-Cindy W.

description: The chicken dinner was very good. Not the best chicken dinner I've ever had but it was four star moist in my book. Drink specials were pricey but yummy. Attentive service. Staff was friendly.  It's always so convenient when the hotel you are staying at has a decent restaurant when it's cold outside and you don't want to go out.
author: Kathleen C.

description: Definitely recommend this place if you're in Union Square! We stayed at the Hilton and were pleased that the restaurant is connected to the hotel but it's not your typical hotel restaurant. The ambience is sophisticated yet casual and the food is fantastic! Amazingly fast and friendly service and a great drink selection. I shared the burger and cauliflower and both were cooked to perfection. Sebastian was a phenomenal server and helped us get the party started!
author: Hannah B.

description: Very good.  I had the big special burger with a duck egg.
author: Dennis D.

description: We made a reservation because this restaurant had so many good reviews.  The hostess was very friendly when we arrived, but  we noticed right away that the noise level was really high.  And then we got seated next to two large groups of obnoxiously loud people.  The options on the menu looked interesting but the wine list was lackluster and uninspired.  So we left
author: Roland L.

description: We went to this place before the theatre.  What a find!  It was literally a perfect meal.  The milk bread was devine.  The beer/cheddar soup was crazy good.  The bolognose was amazing. And for dessert the chocolate boudini was perfection.  Our waiter Josué was delightful.  Definite 5-stars!
author: Paul E.

description: I'm not much of a "talk to the bartender" kind of guy, but I stopped by here after a business meeting to grab a bite and had the pleasure of talking to one of the bartenders, Greg, for a good 10 minutes. He had tons of tips about places to go while at the city. Had a blast during the rest of my visit. Thanks!
author: Arturo R.
